com.magknight.route

Class Route

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magknight.route.Route

  • public class Route
extends java.lang.Object
    The grand implementation class of everything in this project. The Route class implements a route implementation for each phase of flight, has geometric path construction methods for each leg type and holds all necessary information to fly a route. For documented path smoothing algorithms see Skiselkov's openFMC repo:
    Since:
    5/20/2020
    Author:
    Omar Alam and Cian McSweeney
    See Also:
    openFMC join type documentation

      • addLegGroup

        public void addLegGroup(LegGroup legGroup)
        Adds a LegGroup which then will fill in the Leg's it contains from the Nav Database. Leg's are then copied into the Leg's list here in the Route class.
        Parameters:
        legGroup -

      • addLeg

        public void addLeg(Leg leg,
                   int index)
        If user manually add's a leg from the Leg's page of the FMC. We need to reorganise our LegGroups and the Leg's they contain and recalculate our segments.
        Parameters:
        leg -

      • addAllLegs

        public void addAllLegs(java.util.LinkedList<Leg> legs)
        Used so that all legs from a LegGroup can be placed in the main list of Legs here in the Route class. Method calculateSegments() is then called
        Parameters:
        legs -

      • connectCILegWithTurnSegment

        public void connectCILegWithTurnSegment(Leg intcpLeg,
                                        LatLon beginPosition,
                                        Leg subsequentleg,
                                        TurnDirection turnDirection,
                                        double course)
        Connects a CI leg to the next leg segment after an initial turn to the course to intercept.
        Parameters:
        intcpLeg - CI or VI leg
        beginPosition - beginning for leg construction
        subsequentleg - subsequent leg to intercept
        turnDirection - turn direction to intercept subsequent leg
        course - course to intercept subsequent leg with
